item.title: Slow thinking about small samples.
item.description: 1 Small samples are more extreme 2 Visualise the expected variation 3 Stats as slow thinking div#TOC li { list-style:none; background-image:none; background-repeat:none; background-position:0; } In 2006, the statistician Howard Wainer and the education researcher Harris Zwerling wrote a short research paper in which they present two facts about the rate of kidney cancer in US counties. Do me the favour of pausing after reading each and thinking about how you would explain them.
